Topic.Title: Yahoo! Japan up 53% in One Year

Message.Msg: The good news for Yahoo shareholders is that their stake in Yahoo Japan is worth $8.2 billion today vs. $5 billion a year ago. Net of taxes and fees, that Yahoo Japan stake is worth $5.07 per Yahoo share vs. $2.83 per share a year ago.

Topic.Title: How about GOOGLE make an offer for YAHOO..$30.00/share

Message.Msg: I actually own Yahoo. Averaged down so my cost is near market. I agree that Google stock is very expensive. Superior companies command high P/E ratios. Yahoo is an "also ran". No. 1 nowhere. Poor management. No vision. My hope was that Loeb would clean it up for a negotiated sale in the low $20's but he may be bailing! I'm guessing that it will be cut up and sold for parts and existing shareholders will make a few dollars on their current investment.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Closes at New Four Year High of $20.50!

Message.Msg: 1. Not all longs are up as $20.50 is the AVERAGE of the share price therefore just like there are those that own at $9 there are those who own at $90. You're still underwater from the upper $20's no matter how many phantom buys you've made. Some institutions are underwater from $26. The accurate statement is those who've bought in the last 5yrs aren't underwater. 2. Yahoo has removed 200M shares in the last 3yrs so that equates to 15%, which takes the share price to $17.43, a price you've rode down many times especially in the Alipay fiasco when you phantom bought every penny on down. 3. Shorts haven't been in this stock for years as the number of shares is likely a hedge in a pair trade to another tech company. Say "long Google as it goes to new highs and short Yahoo". With Schmidt selling billions the opposite pair trade is likely. 4. As for winning, if you have to claim it or any of your ID's do then you most certainly ain't winning. ***Now here is where I posted some sweet idea's to take advantage of the job market and even using Foursquare technology but your Yahoo brethren doesn't like moneymaking idea's so for that I won't repeat it as I tried to type this earlier***

Message.Title: YHOO has no reliable means to start a company's message board
Message.Msg: YHOO finance is a big selling point of YHOO the stock, but Yahoo finance has managerial problems evidenced by misunderstanding of user experience. Example "ExOne" (new just IPO'd) To start a new message board or correct a Board's name: a user has to suggest the change-- like as in suggesting something new like "there should be Yahoo mail" or "there ought to be Yahoo weather". as if having an IBM discussion board or an AT&T discussion board is structural to the site. Then the suggestion gets combines with other suggestions of other stocks needing a board. This tells me YHOO finance is not well-managed. There is no streamlined manager to write to say there is no EXONE message board or that a company with a name change has no message board.

Topic.Title: Yahoo please help reduce harassment, allow post creators ability to delete own posts

Message.Msg: Yahoo has heard from me uncountable times, they are probably sick of me! But one voice is not always enough-we need many more voices to be heard, we need to band together as a "team" and then we can be noticed much more. Yahoo is under new leadership and we have to think they want to hear us and make things better. ALL we want is a "normal" message board WITHOUT the hate and immature people who have become VERY "childish" here ruining what can be a very good thing, a informative financial MB system, not a "basher forum" for those who disagree. A place where you exchange ideas in a discussion about stocks and WITHOUT degrading it's posters.
